answer3: ③ A vehicle stopped at a red light
answer4: ④ A vehicle stopped to ask a passerby for directions

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following locations allow a motor vehicle to make a stop or park?
answer1: ① Within 50 meters from the main entrance in a school zone
answer2: ② Within 10 meters from a crosswalk
answer3: ③ Within a distance of 5 meters from where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed
answer4: ④ Within 10 meters from a safety zone in all four directions

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following locations allow a motor vehicle to park?
answer1: ① 5 meters from the corner of a road
answer2: ② At a distance of 7 meters or more from where a fire extinguishing water facility is installed
answer3: ③ At a distance of 7 meters or more from where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed
answer4: ④ 5 meters from a safety zone

question: At an intersection with no traffic control, what is the safest method to turn left?
answer1: ① Drive slowly and make a left turn with caution even if there are other vehicles that have entered the intersection ahead of you.
answer2: ② Yield to cars entering from wider roads.
answer3: ③ Yield to cars passing through straight across, but take the right of way over cars trying to turn right.
answer4: ④ Go slowly along the centerline of the road beforehand and make a left turn using the outside center of the intersection.

question: Which one of the following INCORRECTLY describes a safe method to use a roundabout?
answer1: ① Slow down before entering a roundabout.
answer2: ② Stop temporarily at the yield line and enter slowly.
answer3: ③ A vehicle entering the roundabout has the right of way, and the vehicle making a turn in the roundabout must yield.
answer4: ④ Turn counterclockwise.

question: A vehicle that has entered an intersection without traffic lights ahead of you is making a left turn, what should you do?
answer1: ① Proceed with caution if you are going to pass straight through.
answer2: ② If you are going to turn right, make a right turn at low speed.
answer3: ③ If you are going to go straight through or make a right turn, yield to vehicles making left turns.
answer4: ④ If you are driving on a narrow road, pass through the intersection at low speed.

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate method to make a left turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn using the inside of the intersection center.
answer2: ② Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the inside of the intersection center.
answer3: ③ Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the outside of the intersection center.
answer4: ④ Proceed slowly along the center line, and make a left turn in a way that is comfortable for the driver.

question: Which of the following is the proper method to pass through an intersection without traffic control?
answer1: ① Drive slowly when it is impossible to check the sides.
answer2: ② A vehicle turning left has the right of way over a vehicle traveling straight.
answer3: ③ A vehicle turning right has the right of way over a vehicle traveling straight.
answer4: ④ You should drive slowly when the intersection is wider than the road you are on.

question: Which of the following locations requires the installation of a roundabout to facilitate traffic efficiency and safety?
answer1: ① A location where accidents are frequently caused by vehicles traveling straight or turning in an intersection
answer2: ② A location where one or more roads meeting at an intersection has three lanes or more in each direction
answer3: ③ A location where the volume of traffic flow through a roundabout exceeds its capacity
answer4: ④ A location where the signal coordination effect among the relevant sections decreases if a roundabout is constructed

question: Which of the following statements correctly describes a roundabout?
answer1: ① Roundabouts have more conflicting points than signalized intersections.
answer2: ② Vehicles must wait at the yield line until there is room in the roundabout.
answer3: ③ Traffic lights are installed at a roundabout to guide vehicles and facilitate traffic flow through the intersection.
answer4: ④ A vehicle that has already entered a roundabout must yield to an entering vehicle.

question: What is the term used to refer to the road surface markings of white broken lines that are designed to guide left turns at intersections?
answer1: ① Turn lines
answer2: ② Extension lines
answer3: ③ Instruction lines
answer4: ④ Regulation lines

question: Which TWO of the following are correct methods to make a safe left turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① Watch for vehicles from the opposite direction that are stopping.
answer2: ② Watch for vehicles from the opposite direction that are turning right.
answer3: ③ Watch for vehicles from the same direction that are turning right.
answer4: ④ Watch for vehicles in the lane to your side that are also turning left.

question: Which TWO of the following are the safest methods to make a left/right turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① To make a right turn, take the rightmost lane of the road and turn right slowly.
answer2: ② To make a left turn on a congested road, disregard the turn lines on the left and drive quickly.
answer3: ③ To make a left turn, drive slowly along the center line and turn left along the inner part of the intersection.
answer4: ④ To make a left turn at an intersection marked with turn lines, turn with the left tires passing through the inside of the turn lines.

question: Which of the following is a correct guideline with regard to passing through a roundabout?
answer1: ① A car inside the roundabout has the right of way.
answer2: ② A car about to enter the roundabout has the right of way.
answer3: ③ A car exiting the roundabout has the right of way.
answer4: ④ There are no set rules on who has the right of way.

question: Which of the following is NOT prohibited at a roundabout?
answer1: ① Stopping
answer2: ② Parking
answer3: ③ Driving slowly and stopping temporarily
answer4: ④ Overtaking

question: Which of the following represents a turning vehicle for which the right of way is guaranteed at a roundabout?
answer1: ① Vehicles moving on the section of road within the roundabout
answer2: ② Vehicles trying to turn left before entering the roundabout
answer3: ③ Vehicles trying to turn right before entering the roundabout
answer4: ④ Vehicles trying to turn left or right before entering the roundabout

question: Which of the following is an INCORRECT guideline on how to use roundabouts?
answer1: ① Vehicles must approach the roundabout slowly.
answer2: ② A car inside the roundabout has the right of way.
answer3: ③ Vehicles may continually enter the roundabout as there are no signals.
answer4: ④ Turn clockwise in the roundabout.

question: Which TWO of the following are correct methods to pass through a roundabout?
answer1: ① Temporarily stop before entering the roundabout, and enter if there are no vehicles approaching from the left.
answer2: ② Turn clockwise in the roundabout.
answer3: ③ There is no need to operate turn signals when entering/exiting the roundabout.
answer4: ④ Once you are in the roundabout, continue to drive without stopping if possible.

question: Which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily while driving?
answer1: ① Near a curve in a road
answer2: ② Descent on a steep slope
answer3: ③ Near the top of a slope
answer4: ④ At an intersection with no traffic control and heavy traffic

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily?
answer1: ① An intersection without a traffic control officer where traffic to the left and right cannot be checked
answer2: ② An intersection where the lights have turned green
answer3: ③ A busy bridge or tunnel
answer4: ④ In the vicinity of a curve or the highest point on a slope

question: Which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily pursuant to the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① Inside a tunnel and on a bridge
answer2: ② At a busy intersection with no traffic light
answer3: ③ On a descending section of a steep hill
answer4: ④ A curved section of a road

question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the variable speed limit section?
answer1: ① It is an active system that changes the regulated speed in accordance with the situation.
answer2: ② It uses an electric sign that can display different speeds by changing the numbers.
answer3: ③ When the maximum speed is set with a variable speed limit sign, it must be followed.
answer4: ④ When the maximum speed determined by the variable speed limit sign and the maximum speed of the safety sign show different values, the maximum speed indicated by the safety sign must be followed.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver of ( ) must ( ) in front of a railway crossing and then pass through it after confirming that it is safe to cross. Which of the following best fills the parentheses?
answer1: ① any vehicle - slow down
answer2: ② any motor vehicle or heavy equipment - slow down
answer3: ③ any vehicle or tank - stop
answer4: ④ any vehicle or tram - stop

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive at an expressway interchange?
answer1: ① As interchanges tend to be congested, apply sudden brakes to discourage vehicles behind you from following closely and thereby prevent potential accidents.
answer2: ② As drivers tend to become less aware of speed at an interchange, stop momentarily before you continue.
answer3: ③ If the desired interchange has already been passed, use the next interchange.
answer4: ④ Accelerate quickly to enter an interchange.

question: Which of the following is the most correct action to take when a drive of the vehicle ahead stretches his arm horizontally out of the left side of the vehicle?
answer1: ① Slow down as the front vehicle is expected to turn right.
answer2: ② Change course to an upper lane as the vehicle is expected to cross.
answer3: ③ Overtake the vehicle as the front vehicle is expected to make a U-turn.
answer4: ④ Slow down as the front vehicle is expected to change lanes.

question: Which of the following hand signals is used to indicate your intent to turn right?
answer1: ① Extend your left arm out to the left and bend your forearm vertically upward.
answer2: ② Extend your left arm out to the left, parallel to the road.
answer3: ③ Extend your right arm out to the right and hold it parallel to the road and wave the extended arm forwards and backwards.
answer4: ④ Stick your left arm out of the vehicle and bend your forearm downward at an angle of 45°.

question: As a vehicle is about to enter an intersection according to the traffic light, a police officer gives a hand signal to stop. In this scenario, which of the following is the safest way to drive?
answer1: ① Stop just before the stop line.
answer2: ② Decelerate suddenly to slow down.
answer3: ③ Proceed according to the signal from the traffic light.
answer4: ④ Enter the intersection slowly.

question: When there is a yellow broken line alongside a yellow solid line in the middle of a road, which of the following is correct about overtaking?
answer1: ① Overtaking is not allowed from either the yellow broken line or the yellow solid line.
answer2: ② Overtaking is allowed from the side of the yellow broken line.
answer3: ③ Overtaking is allowed from the sides of both the yellow broken line and the yellow solid line if it's clear that it's safe.
answer4: ④ Overtaking is allowed from the side of the yellow solid line.

question: Which of the following is the correct method to drive through a railway crossing?
answer1: ① Drive through if there are no trains coming.
answer2: ② Come to a stop, check that it is safe, and drive through.
answer3: ③ Drive through at a speed above the speed limit.
answer4: ④ Drive at an increased speed if the crossing gate is about to close.

question: Which of the following is the correct method to make a left turn?
answer1: ① Turn on the left turn signal at least 30m (100m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
answer2: ② Turn on the left turn signal at least 10m (100m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
answer3: ③ Turn on the left turn signal at least 20m (80m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
answer4: ④ Turn on the left turn signal when you reach the location where you want to make a left turn.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles, etc.?
answer1: ① Separate legal speed limits are applied to various roads depending on whether it is a general road, exclusive road for motor vehicles, or an expressway, and on the total number of lanes.
answer2: ② There are no minimum speed limits on regular roads.
answer3: ③ You must drive at a reduced speed in poor weather conditions.
answer4: ④ If the speed limit set by the variable speed limit sign and the speed limit set by the speed limit safety sign are different, the latter must be followed.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles, etc.?
answer1: ① Speed limits are set because the likelihood of traffic accidents increases at higher vehicle speeds.
answer2: ② Minimum speed limits are set to maintain the efficiency of vehicle-only lanes and expressways.
answer3: ③ Provisional speed limits can be set by the commissioner general of the Korean National Police Agency, or the commissioner of City/Do police agency for road safety and efficiency.
answer4: ④ For the setting of speed limits on expressways, the commissioner of City/Do police agency has jurisdiction; for all other roads, the commissioner general of the Korean National Police Agency has jurisdiction.

question: Which TWO of the following constitute a violation of traffic signal?
answer1: ① Stopping over the stop line at a red light
answer2: ② Entering an intersection when the lights have already turned yellow
answer3: ③ Driving through carefully when the lights are flashing yellow
answer4: ④ Stopping temporarily in front of the stop line when the lights are blinking red, before driving through carefully

question: When making a right turn at the intersection of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) road, which TWO of the following are the correct methods to proceed?
answer1: ① When making a right turn, switch on the direction indicator right before the intersection to inform others of the direction in which you will proceed.
answer2: ② Even if the signal for pedestrians in the crosswalk of the street to the right is green, you can pass through it when there are no pedestrians in the crosswalk.
answer3: ③ If a supplementary signal for vehicles at the crosswalk is red, you cannot pass even if there are no pedestrians.
answer4: ④ It is safe to make a right turn using the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) road.

question: According to the Motor Vehicle Management Act, which of the following are true about the criteria for a van or bus and the precautions when making a left turn behind a van or bus? (Select two answers)
answer1: ① A bus refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of 36 or more persons. When you are driving behind a bus, you must drive slowly, keeping a safe distance from the bus so that you can see the traffic lights.
answer2: ② A mini-bus refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of between 16 and 35 persons. When you are driving behind a mini-bus and the mini-bus driver turns on a turn signal, slow down and catch up to the mini-bus so that other vehicles won't cut in front of you.
answer3: ③ A van refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of 15 or fewer persons. Since vans are more prone to overturning due to their high center of gravity compared to passenger vehicles, you must keep a safe distance from them.
answer4: ④ A light van refers to a vehicle with an engine displacement below 1,200 cc. Although light vans have the same center of gravity as passenger vehicles, you must keep a safe distance from them.

question: Which TWO of the following correctly describe how to change lanes?
answer1: ① Change lanes while maintaining speed if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is far back enough.
answer2: ② Slow down when you change lanes if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is far back enough.
answer3: ③ Let the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter pass if it is approaching.
answer4: ④ Change your lane quickly if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is approaching.

question: Which TWO of the following statements about the lines that separate lanes are correct?
answer1: ① Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you cannot change from the lane near the solid-line to the lane near the broken-line.
answer2: ② Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you can change from the lane near the solid-line to the lane near the broken-line.
answer3: ③ Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you cannot change from the lane near the broken-line to the lane near the solid-line.
answer4: ④ Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you can change from the lane near the broken-line to the lane near the solid-line.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, what does a flashing red light indicate?
answer1: ① Vehicles and horses must drive slowly while looking out for traffic.
answer2: ② Vehicles and horses may proceed while looking out for traffic.
answer3: ③ Vehicles and horses may reverse while looking out for safety signs.
answer4: ④ Vehicles and horses must temporarily stop right before the stop line and then proceed while looking out for traffic.

question: Which of the following instructions about an intersection with an unprotected left-turn sign is correct?
answer1: ① You can turn left regardless of the signal as long as you look out for traffic.
answer2: ② You can turn left at a red light while looking out for traffic.
answer3: ③ You can turn left at a green light while looking out for traffic.
answer4: ④ You can turn left at a yellow light while looking out for traffic.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles?
answer1: ① The minimum speed limit on expressways is 50 km/h.
answer2: ② Vehicle-only lanes have a maximum speed limit, but no minimum speed limit.
answer3: ③ There are maximum and minimum speed limits on normal roads.
answer4: ④ The maximum speed limit on expressways with more than two lanes in each direction is the same for all types of vehicles.

question: Which of the following is a correct statement about overtaking?
answer1: ① You can overtake a vehicle that is in the process of overtaking another vehicle.
answer2: ② You must overtake on the right when in a tunnel.
answer3: ③ Overtaking on a road with one lane in each direction is only permitted in an area with solid yellow lines.
answer4: ④ Overtaking is prohibited in intersections.

question: Which of the following statements about the center line on a road is correct?
answer1: ① Overtaking is allowed if the center is marked with a yellow solid line.
answer2: ② The center line of a reversible lane is the leftmost yellow broken line in the direction of traffic indicated by traffic signals.
answer3: ③ A bus stopped on a provincial road with one lane in each direction is allowed to be overtaken by crossing the yellow solid center line.
answer4: ④ A center line can be installed on roads that are at least 4.75 m wide.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following vehicles may drive along the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway?
answer1: ① Trucks
answer2: ② Special vehicles
answer3: ③ Vehicles fitted with construction equipment
answer4: ④ Small and mid-sized passenger vehicles

question: If it is necessary to drive in the first lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway at a speed of ( ) kilometers per hour or below due to an increased volume of traffic, etc., it is permissible to do so even when not overtaking another vehicle. Which of the following best fits in the brackets ( )?
Which of the following is true about using a freeway shoulder?
answer1: ① If drowsy while driving, you can pull over on the shoulder to take a rest.
answer2: ② You can park on the shoulder to appreciate a good sunrise.
answer3: ③ You can drive on the shoulder when the freeway is congested.
answer4: ④ The penalty for driving on the shoulder without a good cause is a fine of KRW60,000.

question: According to the standards regarding traffic by lane on an expressway (5 lanes in each direction), which of the following is to be used like the left lane? (There are no dedicated lanes or acceleration/deceleration lanes)
answer1: ① 1~2 lane
answer2: ② 2~3 lane
answer3: ③ 1~3 lane
answer4: ④ 2nd lane only

question: Which of the following is not true about freeway lanes? (Freeways with no bus-only lanes)
answer1: ① Lane 1 of a six-lane freeway can be used by passenger vehicles, light vans, vans, mini-buses and buses to overtake other vehicles.
answer2: ② You can use the lane on the left of the designated lane to overtake another vehicle.
answer3: ③ All vehicles can use the lane on the left of their respective designated lanes.
answer4: ④ The penalty for not using the designated lane for drivers of passenger vehicles is 10 points.

question: Which one of the following is INCORRECT regarding how a passenger car overtakes other vehicles on a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway with smooth traffic?
answer1: ① To overtake, a passenger car changes to Lane 1 and continues in Lane 1.
answer2: ② A large passenger vehicle in Lane 3 changes to Lane 2 in order to overtake.
answer3: ③ A small passenger vehicle uses Lane 1 to overtake.
answer4: ④ A 5-ton truck uses Lane 2 to overtake.

question: Which of the following is an INCORRECT guideline for the use of the right traffic lanes on roadways?
answer1: ① All vehicles may use the right lane of the designated lane.
answer2: ② When a passenger car overtakes another vehicle, it shall use the lane to the immediate right of the lane designated by traffic standards.
answer3: ③ On an eight-lane (four lanes in each direction) general road, a passenger car may drive in any of the lanes.
answer4: ④ On an eight-lane (four lanes in each direction) expressway, a large truck is to use the lane on the right.

question: Which among the following is permitted to use the bus-only lane on a general roadway?
answer1: ① A 12-seater passenger vehicle carrying 6 passengers.
answer2: ② A passenger vehicle for domestic tourists that is transporting 25 tourists.
answer3: ③ A 12-seater commuter passenger vehicle carrying employees on designated routes.
answer4: ④ A taxi temporarily using the lane so that passengers can board/leave the taxi.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act a passenger car with 9 seats can take the bus lane on the highway if ( ) or more people are on the vehicle. Which of the following is correct?
answer1: ① 3
answer2: ② 4
answer3: ③ 5
answer4: ④ 6

question: Which of the following is the appropriate driving standard for a vehicle on a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway? (There are no bus lanes)
answer1: ① Passenger cars are to use Lane 1 and therefore must use only Lane 1.
answer2: ② A small passenger vehicle, the designated lane for which is Lane 2, should use Lane 1 when overtaking.
answer3: ③ Large vans must use the first lane.
answer4: ④ A truck with a maximum load weight of 1.5 tons or less must drive in the Lane 1.

question: A passenger car is driving in the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway. Which lane can it use to overtake another vehicle?
answer1: ① First lane
answer2: ② Second lane
answer3: ③ Third lane
answer4: ④ Any of the above

question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding overtaking?
answer1: ① To overtake another vehicle, you must pass on the left lane of the front vehicle.
answer2: ② If the center line is a yellow broken line, it is possible to overtake when there is no vehicle in the opposite direction.
answer3: ③ In case of reversible lane, overtaking is not allowed on the leftmost yellow broken line in the direction indicated by a traffic light.
answer4: ④ On the one-way 4-lane expressway, vehicles driving on the right lane can move up to the first lane.

question: The following are various guidelines for the passage of a vehicle depending on the lanes according to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree. Which one is NOT correct? (There are no bus lanes)
answer1: ① When proceeding at a slow speed, the driver may use the lane to the right of the current lane in which he/she has been driving.
answer2: ② The first lane of a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) expressway may be used by all motor vehicles to overtake.
answer3: ③ On a one-way traffic road, the rightmost lane is considered the first lane.
answer4: ④ The right lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway is to be used by a truck to drive.

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the standards for vehicles running on a one-way three-lane expressway (no bus-only lane)?
answer1: ① The first lane is the lane for overtaking a passenger car driving on the second lane.
answer2: ② The first lane is the driving lane for a van.
answer3: ③ The roadside is the driving road for emergency vehicles and tow vehicles.
answer4: ④ When operating a bus-only lane, the first lane is the driving road for trucks.

question: According to the definition provided by the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT a type of exclusive lane?
answer1: ① Exclusive lane for buses
answer2: ② Exclusive lane for high-occupancy vehicles
answer3: ③ Exclusive lane for motor vehicles
answer4: ④ Exclusive lane for bicycles

question: Which of the following most appropriately describes aquaplaning?
answer1: ① You must change tires with wider widths to reduce risks involved with aquaplaning.
answer2: ② Aquaplaning is more common in snow than rain. You must reduce speed.
answer3: ③ Tires with worn-down treads will experience less aquaplaning due to reduced traction.
answer4: ④ Under inflation can cause the tires to aquaplane more, especially at higher speeds.

question: Which of the following is the safe method to drive when a vehicle loses control on a frozen road?
answer1: ① Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is spinning.
answer2: ② In the case of a car with manual transmission, shift into high gear.
answer3: ③ Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction.
answer4: ④ Stop the car using the parking brake.

question: Which of the following is the safest method of driving a vehicle on a foggy road?
answer1: ① On a curved road or at an intersection, honk to warn other vehicles to make way and proceed quickly.
answer2: ② In dense fog, keep the high-beam headlights on to secure visibility.
answer3: ③ On a foggy road, switch on the fog light only.
answer4: ④ When visibility is secured to some extent, drive slowly while checking the guardrail, center line, and traffic lane.

question: Which of the following is the safest method to stop on a snowy or icy road?
answer1: ① Apply the brake hard.
answer2: ② Stop quickly using the foot brake and the parking brake at the same time.
answer3: ③ Use the engine brake only to slow down until the car comes to a complete stop.
answer4: ④ After slowing down with the engine brake, step lightly on the brake pedal several times.

question: Which of the following is the most desirable attitude for a driver who drives through an underpass on a road in heavy rain?
answer1: ① All roads are well drained, so there are no danger factors.
answer2: ② Respond to risk factors while listening to disaster information such as disaster broadcasts and information boards.
answer3: ③ Take rest by stopping at the roadside of the underpass until heavy rain passes.
answer4: ④ Drive faster than the designated speed because high speed is required at that moment.

question: Which of the following is the most correct explanation of a frozen or icy road in winter?
answer1: ① It occurs mainly in tunnels, and the road surface becomes an icy road as the fog particles freeze.
answer2: ② Black ice often occurs on bridges, at tunnel entrances, and on shady roads.
answer3: ③ Black ice occurs when snow contaminated with vehicle fumes accumulates on the road surface.
answer4: ④ When passing through an icy road, reduce the speed as much as possible by not operating the steering wheel and braking suddenly.

question: Which of the following is not the right thing to do in case of an accident or fire in a tunnel?
answer1: ① Press the emergency bell situated in the tunnel or call 119.
answer2: ② If you are in the tunnel, continue driving to evacuate the tunnel.
answer3: ③ If you are unable to evacuate the tunnel, pull over on the shoulder or at the emergency parking area.
answer4: ④ When parking inside the tunnel, turn off the engine and promptly evacuate the tunnel.

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate action to take when the brakes are not working on a downhill road?
answer1: ① Turn the ignition off at once.
answer2: ② Jump out of the car after changing to a low gear.
answer3: ③ Reduce your speed by zigzagging.
answer4: ④ Run the car into a guard rail or a wall after reducing the speed by changing to a low gear.

question: If you witness a fire caused by a traffic accident while driving inside a tunnel, which of the following is the most appropriate method to respond?
answer1: ① It is safe to stop your vehicle even if traffic is still flowing.
answer2: ② If traffic is at a standstill, stop the vehicle and wait inside until the fire is extinguished.
answer3: ③ If traffic is at a standstill, stop the vehicle and leave the scene with your car keys.
answer4: ④ If there is a lot of smoke, bend low down to the ground and find the nearest emergency exit in the opposite direction of the smoke.

question: Which of the following is the correct explanation when driving on a sharp curve?
answer1: ① Drive through the curve at the same speed as that before entering the curve.
answer2: ② After entering a curve, it is better to increase the change gear ratio to reduce the centrifugal force.
answer3: ③ A rear-wheel drive vehicle may experience understeer on a curved road.
answer4: ④ In order to reduce oversteer on a curved road, the steering wheel should be turned slightly in the opposite direction of the steering direction.

question: What do you call a problem that occurs when the brakes don't work due to bubbles that form in brake fluid overheated by excessive braking?
answer1: ① Standing wave
answer2: ② Vapor lock
answer3: ③ Road holding
answer4: ④ Under steering

question: Which of the following is not a proper way of driving in fog?
answer1: ① When driving around a curve or on a hill, use the vehicle horn.
answer2: ② If visibility in fog is less than 70 m, reduce speed to less than half of the speed limit.
answer3: ③ Try to maximize visibility by turning on fog lamps and high-beam headlights.
answer4: ④ Even in case of a vehicle failure or a minor accident, move the vehicle to the side of the road.

question: Which of the following is not a correct explanation of black ice in winter?
answer1: ① It is a phenomenon in which a thin ice film forms like a coating on the road surface.
answer2: ② It is a phenomenon in which pollutants in the air are mixed with snow and moisture on the asphalt surface, absorbed, and then frozen into black ice.
answer3: ③ It occurs mainly in places with low temperatures during the winter season, such as on bridges, tunnel entrances, shady roads, and in the shade of mountain corners.
answer4: ④ It refers to the phenomenon where the snow melts and seeps into the sunny road, and the black color of the road is reflected by sunlight and sparkles.

question: Which of the following is not true about icy roads during winter months?
answer1: ① Icy roads are more common on concrete roads than on asphalt.
answer2: ② Ice melts slower on asphalt roads than on concrete.
answer3: ③ The friction coefficient of an asphalt surface increases to 1.6 when dry.
answer4: ④ Under the same conditions, the road friction coefficients of frozen concrete and asphalt surfaces are equal.

question: Which of the following is the least appropriate measure for a driver to take when an earthquake occurs?
answer1: ① Increase your vehicle's speed and quickly pass through the area.
answer2: ② If it is impossible to move using a vehicle, park the vehicle to the side and take shelter.
answer3: ③ Be prepared to move the parked vehicle later by keeping the key in the ignition, and take shelter.
answer4: ④ Turn on the radio to listen to the disaster broadcast.

question: Which TWO of the following describe the correct method to drive in strong winds or storms?
answer1: ① Firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands and stay in your current lane.
answer2: ② Ignore the gusting winds and speed up.
answer3: ③ Park near a sign, traffic lights or a roadside tree.
answer4: ④ Be particularly careful in areas vulnerable to strong winds, such as mountainous areas, bridges, and tunnel exits.

question: Which TWO from the following are the most appropriate explanation regarding driving on a gravel road?
answer1: ① Hold the steering wheel as loosely as possible to minimize the impact on the arm.
answer2: ② Increase the speed while driving to make sure that the wheels are in contact with the road surface as much as possible.
answer3: ③ Slow down to make sure that gravel is not splashed onto pedestrians or other vehicles or horses.
answer4: ④ Slightly lower tire pressure is better for driving than the appropriate level of air pressure.

question: Two vehicles are driving in rain and the rear vehicle saw the front vehicle stopping and applied the brakes. Which of the following is not correct? (Select two answers)
answer1: ① Hard braking can cause the vehicle to nose dive due to increased friction between the road surface and tires.
answer2: ② Free running distance is increased due to reduced friction of the road surface.
answer3: ③ Aquaplaning and partial braking may occur simultaneously, causing the vehicle to slide out of the lane.
answer4: ④ The higher the tire wear rate, the shorter the braking distance.

question: A vehicle is approaching near the top of an uphill. Which TWO from the following are safe ways of driving?
answer1: ① Increase engine RPM (revolutions per minute) to reduce fuel consumption.
answer2: ② At the top of the uphill, be sure to stop temporarily before starting.
answer3: ③ Maintain a safe distance from the front vehicle.
answer4: ④ Drive in a lower gear than higher gear.

question: When you drive downhill, which TWO of the following are the safest methods to drive?
answer1: ① Only use the foot brake because shifting gears is not necessary.
answer2: ② If an emergency situation occurs, use the parking brake immediately.
answer3: ③ Use the same gear you used when driving up the slope.
answer4: ④ Use both the foot brake and engine brake properly.

question: Which of the following is the most correct behavior of a driver to prepare for the long-distance driving during the rainy season?
answer1: ① Replace the antifreeze with distilled water for use as engine coolant.
answer2: ② Reduce the air pressure of tires to improve fuel economy as much as possible.
answer3: ③ Place the insurance certificate to prepare for the submerging of a vehicle.
answer4: ④ Wipe the vehicle window with the defrost agent used during winter time.

question: Which of the following statements about potholes is correct?
answer1: ① Potholes generally form during torrential rain.
answer2: ② Driving faster will prevent tire damage from potholes.
answer3: ③ Sudden braking by larger vehicles is likely to occur near crosswalks when temperature of the road surface increases.
answer4: ④ Potholes are readily visible when the road is dry and you can just drive over them.

question: Which of the following approaches to driving in heavy rainfall is the least safe?
answer1: ① Drive with the headlights and taillights on.
answer2: ② Turn on the heater in internal air circulation mode.
answer3: ③ Check the tires for wear to prevent hydroplaning.
answer4: ④ Maintain double the usual safe distance on wet roads.

question: Which of the following is NOT an appropriate action by a driver while driving on a road during a typhoon accompanied by strong winds and heavy rain?
answer1: ① Since the brake performance decreases significantly, keep twice the usual distance from the front vehicle.
answer2: ② Upon passing the flooded area, it is better to pass without stopping.
answer3: ③ Avoid areas with high risk of flooding such as riverside and stream for parking.
answer4: ④ It is safe to park a vehicle by a wall or under a large sign.

question: Which of the following is an INCORRECT method of driving on snowy roads?
answer1: ① Just clearing the windshield of piled up snow is enough for safe driving.
answer2: ② The foot brake and engine brake must be used together.
answer3: ③ For safety, drive at 30km/h or below with snow chains on.
answer4: ④ Maintain a longer safe distance than usual.

question: Which of the following is not safe driving in rain?
answer1: ① You must reduce speed to less than half of the speed limit depending on the driving condition.
answer2: ② You must drive with reasonable consideration so as not to splash water on pedestrians.
answer3: ③ It is not good to drive in idle creep (a state where the tires move either forward or in reverse even when the accelerator and brake pedals are not applied) when it starts to rain.
answer4: ④ It is safer to drive with the headlights and daytime running lights on even during the day.

question: Which of the following is NOT a safe method to drive on a foggy road?
answer1: ① Turn on the sidelights, taillights, and headlights to indicate your position to other drivers.
answer2: ② Turn the high-beam headlights on to indicate your position to oncoming traffic.
answer3: ③ Maintain a safe distance and reduce speed.
answer4: ④ If moisture is formed on the windshield, use the wipers to secure visibility.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, at which reduced speed should a vehicle drive on a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) motor vehicle-only road when it is wet due to rain?
answer1: ① 80km/h
answer2: ② 90km/h
answer3: ③ 72km/h
answer4: ④ 100km/h

question: Which two of the following are safe methods to drive when lightning strikes?
answer1: ① Park your vehicle under a large tree.
answer2: ② Keep windows closed and stay in the car.
answer3: ③ Keep away from the outer walls of buildings as electricity may conduct down the wet surface.
answer4: ④ Evacuate the vehicle to avoid being in it if it gets hit by lightning.

question: Which of the following is most correct about glare from other cars' headlights?
answer1: ① Glare from headlights mainly affects drivers with poor vision.
answer2: ② Glare from headlights occurs on expressways only.
answer3: ③ Blinding is primarily caused by glare from a car driving in the same direction.
answer4: ④ Frequent occurrence of blindness caused by glare is a factor that increases the risk of accidents while driving.

question: Which of the following is the right method to avoid glare caused by the headlights of an oncoming car at night?
answer1: ① Do not look directly at the headlights but at the road directly in front of your car.
answer2: ② Do not look directly at the headlights but to the right edge of the road.
answer3: ③ Squint your eyes and look at the road directly in front of your car.
answer4: ④ Squint your eyes and look to the left edge of the road.

question: Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not an appropriate action on the part of a driver if the car is unable to operate due to a breakdown on the expressway at night?
answer1: ① A red flashing signal, electric lantern or spark signal that can be identified from 500 meters in all directions must be installed.
answer2: ② When installing a sign, it must be installed in a location where the driver of a vehicle approaching from the rear can see it.
answer3: ③ The driver must take necessary measures, such as moving the vehicle off the expressway.
answer4: ④ The safety tripod sign must be installed 200 meters from the point where the broken-down vehicle is located.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following describes a situation in which a driver of a non-commercial vehicle is required to turn on the headlights, sidelights, taillights, and license plate lights at the same time?
answer1: ① When stopping on a road at nighttime
answer2: ② When stopping on a road with minimal visibility due to fog
answer3: ③ When the vehicle is being towed away due to a parking violation
answer4: ④ While driving inside a tunnel

question: Which of the following is the MOST appropriate action in case of vehicle failure on an expressway?
answer1: ① Turn on the emergency flashing light immediately, stop the car on the road, and notify the insurance company.
answer2: ② Open the trunk, check the broken part quickly, and call a rescue vehicle.
answer3: ③ If it is not possible to move, install a safety tripod 500 meters in front of the broken vehicle.
answer4: ④ If it is possible to move, move the vehicle to the roadside after turning on the emergency flashing light quickly.

question: Which of the following is not true about preventing a tire puncture and measures taken while driving?
answer1: ① You must regularly check the tires for nails.
answer2: ② You must regularly check tire pressures and tread depths.
answer3: ③ If the steering wheel pulls to one side, it is likely that a rear tire is punctured.
answer4: ④ You must try to maintain going straight use the compression release brake to reduce speed.

question: If your vehicle breaks down on an expressway at night, in addition to a safety tripod sign, etc. you must install road flare signals to provide visibility for ( ) and alert other motorists that your car has broken down. Choose the correct one to fill in the brackets.
answer1: ① 200 meters in every direction.
answer2: ② 300 meters in every direction.
answer3: ③ 400 meters in every direction.
answer4: ④ 500 meters in every direction.

question: Which of the following is the correct method to handle a tire that exploded while driving?
answer1: ① If the vehicle is pulled to one side suddenly, press the brakes to prevent an accident.
answer2: ② Firmly grasp the steering wheel, drive straight, and avoid sudden braking. Use the engine brake to stop in a safe location.
answer3: ③ Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is pulled in.
answer4: ④ Use the parking brake to stop the vehicle as the brake pedal won't work.

question: There has been a minor accident on a freeway. Which of the following is the proper measure that you must take in order to prevent a secondary accident?
answer1: ① First and foremost take photos of the accident for insurance purposes.
answer2: ② Explicitly let the other driver know that he/she is at fault and claim for insurance accordingly.
answer3: ③ Immediately place a warning triangle behind the damaged vehicle, move to a safe place, and call the respective authority.
answer4: ④ Turn on the hazard lights and call the respective authority inside your vehicle.

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct statement regarding the expressway construction section?
answer1: ① In the case of construction that blocks a lane, caution is required due to expected congestion.
answer2: ② In the case of a truck, drowsiness and neglect of looking forward can lead to a major accident.
answer3: ③ Various types of construction work including moving construction and stationary construction can be performed.
answer4: ④ The speed limit is set to 80 km/h.

question: Which TWO of the following measures should you take if your Hi-Pass device malfunctions and does not read correctly?
answer1: ① Turn on the emergency flashers, temporarily stop your vehicle, and have a toll ticket issued in a non-automated toll lane.
answer2: ② When you reach the toll gate of your destination, explain where you entered the expressway to the toll collector and pay the toll.
answer3: ③ Use the Hi-Pass lane and go through the toll gate of your destination, and the toll will be automatically collected.
answer4: ④ Detach the card from your Hi-Pass device at the toll gate of your destination and hand it over to the toll collector to pay the toll.

question: Which of the following is the safest action in the event of a fire in a tunnel?
answer1: ① Lock the car's doors to prevent theft and evacuate the tunnel.
answer2: ② Stay in the car as the tunnel will be filled with smoke from the fire.
answer3: ③ Switch off the engine, leave the key in the ignition to allow for the cars to be moved if necessary, and quickly evacuate to safety.
answer4: ④ Make a U-turn and drive away from the exit.

question: Which of the following is an INCORRECT approach to safety while driving through a tunnel?
answer1: ① Before entering the tunnel, remove your sunglasses to allow your eyes adapt to the light, and turn on your headlights as you would at nighttime.
answer2: ② If the lanes inside the tunnel are marked with solid white lines, do not change lanes while in the tunnel.
answer3: ③ Keep a safe following distance from the car ahead and be ready for sudden stops.
answer4: ④ Before entering the tunnel, check the road information at the entrance to the tunnel.

question: Which of the following statements about braking in an emergency situation that occurs while driving is correct?
answer1: ① If hydroplaning occurs, the braking force of the brakes gets stronger.
answer2: ② Utilizing the impact-absorbing barrier in an emergency situation is one way to prevent a fatal accident.
answer3: ③ If the road surface is wet, the vehicle always slides straight forward upon pressing the brake suddenly.
answer4: ④ The braking distance of vehicles equipped with ABS is half that of vehicles without ABS.

question: Which TWO of the following are correct safety measures to take during an earthquake?
answer1: ① Drive as quickly as possible out of the area affected by the earthquake.
answer2: ② Maintain a safe distance from other vehicles and pull over to the right-hand side of the road.
answer3: ③ Turn off the engine if you need to get out of the car to take cover.
answer4: ④ Ignore the earthquake and drive on.

question: You are driving on a freeway and there is ongoing construction ahead. Which of the following is not true? (Select two answers
answer1: ① Stay cautious when driving toward and by a construction site.
answer2: ② Drive faster than what is indicated on the construction speed limit sign.
answer3: ③ Try not to make excessive overtaking or cut in front of cars.
answer4: ④ Drive at the same speed when approaching the construction site so as not to cause unnecessary traffic disruptions.
answer5: ⑤ In areas where the speed limit changes, turn on the hazard lights to alert the other vehicles.

question: Which TWO of the following are correct measures to take when a fire starts inside a tunnel that you are driving in?
answer1: ① Turn off the engine if you are getting out of the car to evacuate.
answer2: ② Stand with your back to the wind when using a fire extinguisher.
answer3: ③ If you are unable to drive out of the tunnel, stop the car as close to the center line as possible.
answer4: ④ Take the key out of the ignition if you are getting out of the car to evacuate.

question: Which TWO of the following statements about a vehicle skid are correct?
answer1: ① Skidding mostly occurs when the brakes are applied suddenly while driving at a high speed.
answer2: ② Skidding mostly occurs when driving at a low speed in the rain.
answer3: ③ Skid marks left on a road surface do not provide any clues as to why an accident occurred.
answer4: ④ Even a vehicle with ABS can skid.

question: In which TWO of the following situations is a vehicle most likely to deviate from the road?
answer1: ① When driving on an uphill road
answer2: ② When the driver abruptly turns the steering wheel on a curved road
answer3: ③ When driving on a downhill road
answer4: ④ When the road surface is slippery

question: If the hood of the car starts generating smoke and catches fire on an expressway, which TWO of the following are the most appropriate measures to take?
answer1: ① Stop immediately when you notice that there is a problem.
answer2: ② Move to the roadside, turn off the engine, and evacuate out of the vehicle.
answer3: ③ If it is early enough to extinguish the fire, use the fire extinguisher fitted in the vehicle.
answer4: ④ If you fail to extinguish the fire, call 119 and wait right next to the vehicle.

question: In which section do the lanes start to decrease before passing the following construction section?
answer1: ① Caution section
answer2: ② Relief section
answer3: ③ Work section
answer4: ④ End section

question: Which of the following is the MOST correct description regarding driving at night?
answer1: ① It is possible to secure a wide view at night if you have the front window tinted.
answer2: ② On a clear day, the braking distance is longer during daytime than at night.
answer3: ③ It is better to secure a front view when driving at night with the fog light on rather than headlights.
answer4: ④ If you look at the light from the opposite vehicle directly, it may be hard to secure a front view due to the glare.

question: Which of the following is a correct statement about the evaporation phenomenon (cases when you are unable to see ahead due to the glare from the vehicle's headlights) during nighttime?
answer1: ① The evaporation phenomenon will disappear if you turn off your headlights immediately when it occurs.
answer2: ② The evaporation phenomenon frequently occurs when two vehicles facing each other both have their high-beam headlights on.
answer3: ③ The evaporation phenomenon tends to occur when driving through busy downtown streets at nighttime.
answer4: ④ The evaporation phenomenon refers to the condition of momentary invisibility caused by bright lights upon entering a tunnel at nighttime.

question: Which of the following statements about a driver's 'under aroused driving' at nighttime is correct?
answer1: ① Cognitive ability is better than usual.
answer2: ② Eye movements become more active.
answer3: ③ It often occurs when driving on congested roads in a city.
answer4: ④ The eyes become used to a monotonous visibility and experience a type of sensory paralysis.

question: Which of the following is NOT a measure to be taken by a driver when the sun begins to set and it becomes dark?
answer1: ① Turn on the sidelights and taillights.
answer2: ② Drive slower than you would during the day.
answer3: ③ The eyes need some time to adjust to the darkness after the sun sets.
answer4: ④ Driving is easier compared to daytime driving because of greater visibility.

question: Which of the following statements regarding the electric vehicle charging cable coupler is incorrect?
answer1: ① It should have separate polarity and grounding electrode as it has a structure that cannot be replaced with other wiring equipment.
answer2: ② The grounding electrode should have a structure that is connected last when starting and separated first upon shutoff.
answer3: ③ It should have a mechanical device for locking or attachment/detachment to prevent unintended load shedding.
answer4: ④ It should have an interlock function that suspends the power supply of charging cable when the connector of an electric vehicle is separated from the connection port.

question: Which of the following is the best method to prevent vehicle fires?
answer1: ① Alter the wiring arrangement to install an amplifier in the vehicle.
answer2: ② Avoid generating static electricity while filling up in the wintertime.
answer3: ③ LPG vehicles should carry a disposable butane gas tank in preparation for an emergency.
answer4: ④ A lighter can be stored inside the vehicle in the summer.

question: Which of the following is the best method to prevent the risk of collision caused by the sudden braking of a vehicle ahead?
answer1: ① Step on the brake pedal to slow down until just before the collision.
answer2: ② Turn the steering wheel sharply to the left and drive over the center line to avoid hitting the vehicle ahead.
answer3: ③ Close your eyes to minimize the impact.
answer4: ④ Turn on both the wipers and high-beam headlights.

question: Which TWO of the following are caused by the tires of a vehicle driving at a high speed?
answer1: ① Vapor lock
answer2: ② Standing wave
answer3: ③ Fading
answer4: ④ Hydroplaning

question: Which of the following is correct regarding wearing a seat belt?
answer1: ① Fix the seat belt above the waist to protect against the shock from a traffic accident.
answer2: ② Firefighters who are dispatched to suppress fire need not wear a seat belt.
answer3: ③ It is safest for children to take the front seat and wear a seat belt.
answer4: ④ If a driver does not ensure that children under the age of 13 wear a seat belt, a fine of KRW 30,000 is imposed.

question: Which of the following should you adjust before you start driving in order to minimize injuries to the head and neck?
answer1: ① Distance of the seat from the pedals
answer2: ② Angle of the backrest
answer3: ③ Height of the headrest
answer4: ④ Seat height

question: Which of the following is correct regarding safe driving in a tunnel?
answer1: ① Turn on the left turn signal and turn left for overtaking.
answer2: ② The sense of distance from the front vehicle is reduced in a tunnel.
answer3: ③ When entering the tunnel, be careful of the light adaptation phenomenon.
answer4: ④ At the exit of a tunnel, a dark adaptation phenomenon occurs.

question: Which of the following is true about using turn signals?
answer1: ① It is not a violation to change lanes without signaling if it does not obstruct the other vehicles.
answer2: ② You must keep the turning signal on for a while after changing lanes.
answer3: ③ The penalty for a failure to signal lane change for passenger vehicles and vans is a fine of KRW 30,000.
answer4: ④ When changing lanes on a freeway, turn on the turn signal from 30 m before and keep it on until you have changed lanes.

question: In which of the following situations is a driver allowed to overtake a vehicle?
answer1: ① When the vehicle ahead is overtaking another vehicle
answer2: ② When the vehicle ahead stops or is driving slowly to prevent a dangerous situation
answer3: ③ When the vehicle ahead is driving next to another vehicle in the left lane
answer4: ④ When the vehicle ahead is driving slowly to secure a safe distance with another vehicle

question: Which of the following is correct about the speed limit of a vehicle trying to overtake another vehicle?
answer1: ① There is no speed limit applied to a vehicle overtaking another one.
answer2: ② A vehicle overtaking another vehicle can exceed the legal speed limit of the road by 50%.
answer3: ③ Vehicles are allowed to overtake other vehicles regardless of the speed limit, depending on the driver's driving skill.
answer4: ④ Overtaking other vehicles is allowed only when it is performed within the speed limit of the road.

question: Idling or parking on a freeway is prohibited as it may cause rear-end collisions. Which of the following is not true?
answer1: ① A fire truck can idle or park on a freeway to perform emergency operations.
answer2: ② You can temporarily idle or park at the instruction of a police officer or to prevent a hazardous situation.
answer3: ③ Motor vehicles can idle on the toll road to pay their tolls.
answer4: ④ Only emergency vehicles like police cars and fire trucks can idle or park at the emergency parking area inside a tunnel.

question: When you sense danger while driving and step on the brake pedal, which TWO of the following will lead to the longest stopping distance? (i. e. the distance from the point where you press the brake pedal to the point where the vehicle actually stops.)
answer1: ① Relatively light vehicle weight
answer2: ② Relatively higher speed
answer3: ③ Right after installing new tires
answer4: ④ Fatigue or drunk driving

question: Which TWO from the following is correct regarding the number of passengers in a vehicle?
answer1: ① On expressways, it is not allowed to carry more people than the defined number of passengers for the vehicle.
answer2: ② The number of passengers specified on the vehicle registration certificate is the number of passengers excluding the driver.
answer3: ③ When permission is obtained from the head of the police station having jurisdiction over the place of departure, the vehicle may operate in excess of the designated number of passengers.
answer4: ④ If the number of passengers is exceeded, permission must be obtained from the head of the police station having jurisdiction over the destination.

question: When a vehicle driving in front brakes suddenly due to a traffic accident ahead, which TWO of the following are the safest measures to avoid colliding with the vehicle?
answer1: ① Maintain a longer distance from the vehicle ahead than the stopping distance.
answer2: ② Turn on the emergency flashers and follow an emergency vehicle.
answer3: ③ Reduce speed and maintain sufficient distance with the vehicle ahead to prevent a collision.
answer4: ④ When there is any danger, use both the foot brake and parking brake to shorten the braking distance.

question: Which of the following are true about wearing seat belts? (Select two answers)
answer1: ① The penalty for a driver failing to wear a seat belt is a fine of KRW30,000.
answer2: ② Whiplash injuries are more common with two-point seat belts.
answer3: ③ The penalty for a child under the age of 13 not wearing a seat belt is a fine of KRW60,000.
answer4: ④ There are two, three, and four-point seat belts.

question: Which TWO of the following are correct about wearing a seat belt?
answer1: ① You do not have to wear a seat belt when driving to a place close by.
answer2: ② Passengers in a car should wear a seat belt for safety.
answer3: ③ It is safe to make a child sit in the passenger seat so that the parents can help the child wear a seat belt.
answer4: ④ Except when there is an emergency, the driver of an emergency vehicle should also wear a seat belt.

question: A person seems to be suffering from a fractured spine after an accident. Which of the following is the most appropriate measure you can take?
answer1: ① Check if the person is conscious and perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation immediately.
answer2: ② Move the person to a safe place and call 119.
answer3: ③ Apply the Heimlich maneuver to prevent upper airway obstruction.
answer4: ④ Unless urgent, do not move the person. If moving is inevitable, use a spine splint and assist the person in moving to a safe place.

question: When you are involved in a traffic accident, what should you do first to check if an injured person is conscious?
answer1: ① Check their pulse.
answer2: ② Try to start a conversation or gently pat their shoulders.
answer3: ③ Find the location of any wound that is bleeding heavily.
answer4: ④ Look into their mouth to check if anything is blocking their airway.

question: Which TWO vehicles from the following are allowed to continue driving while asking a passenger to take actions during a traffic accident?
answer1: ① A passenger car that is carrying an injured person to a hospital.
answer2: ② A fire truck returning to the fire station after extinguishing the fire
answer3: ③ A tow vehicle going to the scene of a traffic accident
answer4: ④ A postal service car that is carrying parcels.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act which TWO from the following are correct regarding a vehicle that is allowed to continue driving despite a traffic accident?
answer1: ① The ambulance driver who was transporting an urgent patient had the passenger take the necessary measures and kept driving.
answer2: ② The driver, who was traveling to attend an urgent meeting, had the passenger take the necessary actions and kept driving.
answer3: ③ The driver of the vehicle transporting urgent mail made the passenger take the necessary measures and kept driving.
answer4: ④ The ambulance driver, who was transporting urgent medicines, had the passengers take the necessary actions and kept driving.

question: Which of the following is not appropriate to prevent roadkills at night?
answer1: ① Reduce speed when traveling on national or mountain roads with fewer vehicles or people.
answer2: ② If you spot an animal on the road, slow down or stop on the shoulder to avoid a collision.
answer3: ③ If you spot an animal on the road, turn off the headlights and lightly sound the horn to scare it away.
answer4: ④ To more easily spot animals on the road, drive closer along the shoulder.

question: Which of the following organizations provides free towing service over a set distance in the event of an emergency?
answer1: ① Road Traffic Authority
answer2: ② Korea Expressway Corporation
answer3: ③ Police agency
answer4: ④ Korea Transportation Safety Authority

question: Which of the following is not a proper way to respond after roadkill?
answer1: ① Do not touch the animal carcass to prevent exposure to potential diseases.
answer2: ② Call any wildlife rescue center or a local government (area code + 120).
answer3: ③ Load the animal carcass on your vehicle to prevent a secondary accident.
answer4: ④ There is no need to file a report if necessary measures have been taken to prevent a secondary accident and facilitate the traffic flow.

question: Which of the following is true about anger control techniques for preventing road rage and car crashes?
answer1: ① An anger control technique that is a mindfulness-based practice designed to help you defuse stress is called the STOP technique.
answer2: ② An anger control technique during which you try to push out the negative thoughts and focus on happy thoughts for 1-2 minutes is called the time-out technique.
answer3: ③ An anger control technique during which you question yourself about the passive recognition of the belief system and distorted thoughts that trigger anger is called the reminiscence technique.
answer4: ④ An anger control technique during which you repeatedly contract and relax your arms, legs, abdomen, chest, shoulders and other body parts is called the contract-relax stretching technique.

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive when the underground road ahead is submerged in water due to heavy rainfall?
answer1: ① Drive through slowly. You can make it as long as the wheels are not completely submerged in water.
answer2: ② Get through the water as fast as you can.
answer3: ③ Take another road to bypass the water.
answer4: ④ Drive through. If the engine stops, start it back immediately and drive through.

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct description regarding actions when responding to emergency situation such as a traffic accident?
answer1: ① Check the risk.
answer2: ② Check the response of a patient.
answer3: ③ Secure the airway and check the breathing
answer4: ④ Check the destination and identification of a patient.

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct method to handle a dangerous situation while driving?
answer1: ① Firmly grasp the steering wheel if it vibrates hard and keep driving.
answer2: ② If smoke comes out of the vehicle, pull over where it is safe and turn off the engine.
answer3: ③ If a tire explodes, hold the steering wheel firmly and pull over to a safe location.
answer4: ④ If the engine stops while crossing a railroad, evacuate the vehicle immediately and contact the authorities.

question: Which of the following are proper ways to take photographs at the scene of an accident? (Select two answers)
answer1: ① If there is a black box that successfully captured the accident, there is no need to take any photos.
answer2: ② Photos of spilled engine oil and coolant are not needed as their stains will last a long time on the road.
answer3: ③ Take photos of the overall accident scene from a distance and work your way toward the point of collision, taking photos along the way.
answer4: ④ Mark the scene by spray painting or taking photos of the direction of the tires.

question: Which TWO of the following must be inspected before starting a long-distance drive?
answer1: ① Cleanliness of the vehicle
answer2: ② DMB operation status
answer3: ③ Oils and fluids
answer4: ④ Tires

question: Which of the following constitutes a cause for revocation of a driver's license?
answer1: ① When 6 months have elapsed after the expiration date of the regular aptitude test
answer2: ② When a motorist is booked without detention for assaulting a law enforcement officer (policeman or local government official)
answer3: ③ When a motorist drives his/her car without affixing a license plate after registration
answer4: ④ When two years have elapsed without renewal of a Class II driver's license for an ordinary motor vehicle

question: If a person notified to pay a fine fails to make the payment during the first designated period, which of the following is the correct amount the person has to pay within 20 days?
answer1: ① Original fine + 10% late penalty
answer2: ② Original fine + 20% late penalty
answer3: ③ Original fine + 30% late penalty
answer4: ④ Original fine + 40% late penalty

question: Which of the following is the correct standard for the cancellation of a driver's license based on cumulative demerit points?
answer1: ① 100+ points within 1 year
answer2: ② 191+ points within 2 years
answer3: ③ 271+ points within 3 years
answer4: ④ 301+ points within 5 years

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the standards for demerit points based on the effects of a traffic accident?
answer1: ① As for the personal injury of the driver who will receive an administrative punishment, demerit points will be given based on the rules regarding traffic accidents involving personal injury.
answer2: ② In an accident between a car and a pedestrian, demerit points will not be given if the accident occurred due to both parties committing mistakes.
answer3: ③ If the accident was unavoidable or had been caused clearly by a mistake of the injured, demerit points will be halved.
answer4: ④ In an accident between cars, demerit points are given only to the driver who committed a serious violation that caused the accident.

question: Which of the following statements regarding the penalty for parking violations is correct?
answer1: ① The owner of a passenger car involved in a parking violation should pay a fine of KRW 30,000.
answer2: ② The owner of a van involved in a parking violation should pay a fine of KRW 70,000.
answer3: ③ No penalty is given even if you do not pay the fine during the designated period.
answer4: ④ For parking violations that continue for more than two hours at the same location, additional fines are imposed.

question: Which of the following is a scenario in which the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents is applied because the driver who caused the accident has comprehensive insurance or is insured through a mutual aid association?
answer1: ① When the driver has violated his/her duty to drive safely, resulting in car damage or a minor accident
answer2: ② When the driver has caused an accident that resulted in loss of human life
answer3: ③ When the driver has fled the scene after causing an accident, without attending to the injured
answer4: ④ When the driver has violated traffic signals, causing an accident involving minor injuries

question: 7 acquaintances split up into 4 different vehicles and caused harm to others on the road; they were pressed for criminal charges. Which of the following punishment criteria is incorrect?
answer1: ① Up to 2 years' imprisonment or fine of up to KRW 5 million
answer2: ② Up to 3 years' imprisonment or fine of up to KRW 10 million
answer3: ③ Driver's license cancellation if the driver is detained.
answer4: ④ Demerit of 40 points in case of criminal charges

question: The driver of an automobile is arrested for reckless driving. Which of the following is the correct administrative disposition of the driver's license?
answer1: ① Revocation of the driver's license
answer2: ② 100-day suspension of the driver's license
answer3: ③ 60-day suspension of the driver's license
answer4: ④ 40-day suspension of the driver's license

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the punishment for riding a bicycle while intoxicated?
answer1: ① No punishment
answer2: ② Notification of a minor offense penalty of KRW 30,000
answer3: ③ Punished through an administrative fine of KRW 40,000
answer4: ④ Punished through an administrative fine not exceeding KRW 100,000 or by detention

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the action taken if a bicycle rider, who has considerable reason to be suspected of being intoxicated, refuses a police officer's demand for a breathalyzer test?
answer1: ① No punishment
answer2: ② Punished through an administrative fine of KRW 70,000
answer3: ③ Notification through a minor offense penalty of KRW 100,000
answer4: ④ Punished through an administrative fine not exceeding KRW 100,000 or by detention

question: Which TWO of the following situations are subject to criminal prosecution in accordance with the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
answer1: ① A driver without comprehensive insurance reaches a settlement with the victim after causing an accident resulting in property damage.
answer2: ② A taxi driver who is a member of the Taxi Mutual Aid Association causes a traffic accident resulting in injury or death after driving over the center line.
answer3: ③ A driver with comprehensive insurance causes a traffic accident resulting in injury or death after committing a violation of traffic signal.
answer4: ④ A freight vehicle driver who is a member of the Trucking Association causes a traffic accident resulting in property damage after failing to drive safely.

question: You fail to pay a fine, for which you have been notified in writing, even by its second deadline. Which TWO of the following are applicable?
answer1: ① You must request a summary judgment immediately.
answer2: ② Your license will be suspended for 40 days if no summary judgment is reached.
answer3: ③ A penalty will be charged.
answer4: ④ No summary judgment needs to be requested if you pay the fine along with an additional 30% as a delay penalty.

question: According to Road Traffic Act what punishment is imposed when a driver causes a traffic accident that harms vehicles parked or stopped and does not provide his/her personal information to the victim(s)?
answer1: ① No punishment
answer2: ② Impose penalty of KRW 100,000.
answer3: ③ Notify penalty of KRW 120,000.
answer4: ④ Impose fine of up to KRW 300,000 or detention.

question: Which of the following is the correct punishment criterion for anyone driving while intoxicated with a blood alcohol content of 0.03% or more and less than 0.08%? (In the case of a first-time violation)
answer1: ① Imprisonment up to 1 year or a fine up to KRW 5 million
answer2: ② Imprisonment up to 2 years or a fine up to KRW 10 million
answer3: ③ Imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine up to KRW 15 million
answer4: ④ Imprisonment in the range of 2 years - 5 years or a fine of KRW 10 million or more (up to KRW 20 million)

question: Your appeal regarding the administrative action against your driver's license has been accepted. Which of the following is the correct reduction applicable to the revocation of your license?
answer1: ① 90 demerit points
answer2: ② 100 demerit points
answer3: ③ 110 demerit points
answer4: ④ 120 demerit points

question: If a driver with a student license drives in an inebriated state with a blood alcohol content not less than ( ) percent, his/her student license shall be revoked. Which answer fits in ( )?
Which of the following is the punishment imposed on a driver who has been criminally charged for assaulting a traffic police officer?
answer1: ① 40 demerit points
answer2: ② 100 demerit points
answer3: ③ Revocation of the driver's license
answer4: ④ Request for a summary trial

question: Each time a driver (if not a victim of a traffic accident) arrests or reports to arrest a driver of a vehicle that has caused a traffic accident involving personal injury and fled, a benefit of ( ) shall be given. What is true of ( )
answer1: ① 10 points
answer2: ② 20 points
answer3: ③ 30 points
answer4: ④ 40 points

question: Which of the following is an incorrect pairing of fines and violations by the driver of a passenger car?
answer1: ① KRW 120,000 for a speed violation (Exceeding 60 kilometers per hour)
answer2: ② KRW 60,000 for a signal violation
answer3: ③ KRW 60,000 for driving over the center line
answer4: ④ KRW 50,000 for violation of the period or place in which overtaking is prohibited

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the fine imposed on the driver of a passenger car parked within 5 meters of the transmission valve of a fire department standpipe used for fire extinguishing purposes?
answer1: ① KRW 40,000
answer2: ② KRW 30,000
answer3: ③ KRW 20,000
answer4: ④ No fine is imposed.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following violations involves a different criterion for demerit points?
answer1: ① Driving while neglecting disorderly conduct by a passenger inside the vehicle
answer2: ② Violating the method of passing a railroad crossing
answer3: ③ Violation of passage on a roadside in an expressway
answer4: ④ Violation of the exclusive lane for buses on an expressway

question: When a driver subject to a summary judgment pays the total sum of the due fine in addition to ( ) of the fine and submits a document confirming the payment before the announcement of the summary judgment, the police chief is required to cancel the summary judgment on the driver. Select one of the following to fill in the brackets.

Which of the following is the correct punishment criteria if the driver of an automobile refuses a police officer's legitimate demand for a breathalyzer test in a situation where the police officer has considerable reason to suspect that the driver is intoxicated?
answer1: ① Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than two years, or a fine up to KRW 5 million
answer2: ② Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than three years, or a fine up to KRW 10 million
answer3: ③ Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than four years, or a fine in the range of KRW 5 million - KRW 10 million
answer4: ④ Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than five years or a fine in the range of KRW 5 million - KRW 20 million

question: Which of the following vehicles attracts a different fine compared to the others when its driver commits a violation of traffic signal?
answer1: ① Van
answer2: ② Passenger car
answer3: ③ Special vehicle
answer4: ④ Construction equipment

question: The driver of a vehicle is traveling on an expressway without carrying a vehicle breakdown sign (safety tripod sign) inside the vehicle. What will happen?
answer1: ① A fine of KRW 20,000 will be charged.
answer2: ② The driver will be imposed with a fine of KRW 20,000.
answer3: ③ A fine of up to KRW 300,000 will be charged.
answer4: ④ No fine or penalty will be imposed.

question: Which of the following is the correct pairing of fine and speed range imposed on the driver of a passenger car caught speeding on an expressway?
answer1: ① For exceeding the speed limit by over 60 km/h to 80 km/h
answer2: ② For exceeding the speed limit by over 40 to 60 km/h
answer3: ③ For exceeding the speed limit by over 20 to 40 km/h
answer4: ④ For exceeding the speed limit by below 20 km/h

question: Which of the following is the correct statement regarding the demerit points applied to a driver who causes an accident?
answer1: ① When a traffic accident occurs in which one death (within 72 hours) is caused due to the violation of a signal, a penalty of 105 demerit points is incurred.
answer2: ② Demerit points are also applied for losses that passengers of the victim's vehicle and the driver of the offending vehicle suffered.
answer3: ③ Demerit points are calculated based on the cause of the accident, any casualties, and damage to property.
answer4: ④ If the accident involves two vehicles, no demerit points are applied if both vehicles are responsible for the accident.

question: According to Road Traffic Act the medical checkup result report that determines whether a driver is eligible for an aptitude test or not should be the document issued within ( ) from the driver's license application date. Which of the following is correct?
answer1: ① 1 year
answer2: ② 2 years
answer3: ③ 3 years
answer4: ④ 4 years

question: In accordance with the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, if you object to the revocation of your driver's license, when can you submit an application to the Objections Deliberation Committee of the Metropolitan Police?
answer1: ① Within 90 days of the revocation
answer2: ② Within 90 days of becoming aware of the revocation
answer3: ③ Within 60 days of the revocation
answer4: ④ Within 60 days of becoming aware of the revocation
